channel.title: CVE Feed for ASUS -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ASUS -- all products

item.title: CVE-2019-11063|2024-08-04T22:40:16.212Z -- asus -- smarthome%20android%20app
item.description: A broken access control vulnerability in SmartHome app (Android versions up to 3.0.42_190515, ios versions up to 2.0.22) allows an attacker in the same local area network to list user accounts and control IoT devices that connect with its gateway (HG100) via http://[target]/smarthome/devicecontrol without any authentication. CVSS 3.0 base score 10 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H).

item.title: CVE-2021-44158|2024-08-04T04:17:24.526Z -- asus -- rt-ax56u
item.description: ASUS RT-AX56U Wi-Fi Router is vulnerable to stack-based buffer overflow due to improper validation for httpd parameter length. An authenticated local area network attacker can launch arbitrary code execution to control the system or disrupt service.

item.title: CVE-2019-11061|2024-08-04T22:40:16.125Z -- asus -- hg100%20firmware
item.description: A broken access control vulnerability in HG100 firmware versions up to 4.00.06 allows an attacker in the same local area network to control IoT devices that connect with itself via http://[target]/smarthome/devicecontrol without any authentication. CVSS 3.0 base score 10 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H).

item.title: CVE-2019-11060|2024-08-04T22:40:16.207Z -- asus -- hg100%20firmware
item.description: The web api server on Port 8080 of ASUS HG100 firmware up to 1.05.12, which is vulnerable to Slowloris HTTP Denial of Service: an attacker can cause a Denial of Service (DoS) by sending headers very slowly to keep HTTP or HTTPS connections and associated resources alive for a long period of time. CVSS 3.0 Base score 7.4 (Availability impacts). CVSS vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H).

item.title: CVE-2021-37910|2024-08-04T01:30:09.144Z -- asus -- gt-axe11000
item.description: ASUS routers Wi-Fi protected access protocol (WPA2 and WPA3-SAE) has improper control of Interaction frequency vulnerability, an unauthenticated attacker can remotely disconnect other users' connections by sending specially crafted SAE authentication frames.

item.title: CVE-2021-41289|2024-08-04T03:08:31.886Z -- asus -- p453uj%20bios
item.description: ASUS P453UJ contains the Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer vulnerability. With a general userâ€™s permission, local attackers can modify the BIOS by replacing or filling in the content of the designated Memory DataBuffer, which causing a failure of integrity verification and further resulting in a failure to boot.

item.title: CVE-2023-35720|2024-08-02T16:30:44.421Z -- asus -- rt-ax92u
item.description:
ASUS RT-AX92U lighttpd mod_webdav.so SQL Injection Information Disclosure Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected ASUS RT-AX92U routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the mod_webdav.so module. When parsing a request, the process does not properly validate a user-supplied string before using it to construct SQL queries. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to disclose information in the context of root. Was ZDI-CAN-16078.

item.title: CVE-2024-3912|2024-08-01T20:26:57.193Z -- asus -- dsl-n17u
item.description: Certain models of ASUS routers have an arbitrary firmware upload vulnerability. An unauthenticated remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary system commands on the device.

item.title: CVE-2024-0401|2024-08-01T18:04:49.502Z -- asus -- expertwifi
item.description: ASUS routers supporting custom OpenVPN profiles are vulnerable to a code execution vulnerability. An authenticated and remote attacker can execute arbitrary operating system commands by uploading a crafted OVPN profile. Known affected routers include ASUS ExpertWiFi, ASUS RT-AX55, ASUS RT-AX58U, ASUS RT-AC67U, ASUS RT-AC68R, ASUS RT-AC68U, ASUS RT-AX86, ASUS RT-AC86U, ASUS RT-AX88U, and ASUS RT-AX3000.

item.title: CVE-2024-1655|2024-08-01T18:48:21.610Z -- asus -- expertwifi%20ebm63
item.description: Certain ASUS WiFi routers models has an OS Command Injection vulnerability, allowing an authenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary system commands by sending a specially crafted request.

item.title: CVE-2024-31161|2024-07-16T17:06:54.254Z -- asus -- download%20master
item.description: The upload functionality of ASUS Download Master does not properly filter user input. Remote attackers with administrative privilege can exploit this vulnerability to upload any file to any location. They may even upload malicious web page files to the website directory, allowing arbitrary system commands to be executed upon browsing the webpage.

item.title: CVE-2024-31162|2024-06-18T20:43:05.443Z -- asus -- download%20master
item.description: The specific function parameter of ASUS Download Master does not properly filter user input. An unauthenticated remote attacker with administrative privileges can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary system commands on the device.

item.title: CVE-2024-3079|2024-06-17T19:28:48.754Z -- asus -- zenwifi%20xt8
item.description: Certain models of ASUS routers have buffer overflow vulnerabilities, allowing remote attackers with administrative privileges to execute arbitrary commands on the device.

item.title: CVE-2024-3080|2024-06-17T13:36:27.202Z -- asus -- zenwifi%20xt8
item.description: Certain ASUS router models have authentication bypass vulnerability, allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to log in the device.

item.title: CVE-2024-0401|2024-06-04T17:58:40.749Z -- asus -- expertwifi
item.description: ASUS routers supporting custom OpenVPN profiles are vulnerable to a code execution vulnerability. An authenticated and remote attacker can execute arbitrary operating system commands by uploading a crafted OVPN profile. Known affected routers include ASUS ExpertWiFi, ASUS RT-AX55, ASUS RT-AX58U, ASUS RT-AC67U, ASUS RT-AC68R, ASUS RT-AC68U, ASUS RT-AX86, ASUS RT-AC86U, ASUS RT-AX88U, and ASUS RT-AX3000.

item.title: CVE-2023-35720|2024-06-04T17:18:10.530Z -- asus -- rt-ax92u
item.description:
ASUS RT-AX92U lighttpd mod_webdav.so SQL Injection Information Disclosure Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected ASUS RT-AX92U routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the mod_webdav.so module. When parsing a request, the process does not properly validate a user-supplied string before using it to construct SQL queries. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to disclose information in the context of root. Was ZDI-CAN-16078.

item.title: CVE-2024-31159|2024-06-14T03:25:03.735Z -- asus -- download%20master
item.description: The parameter used in the certain page of ASUS Download Master is not properly filtered for user input. A remote attacker with administrative privilege can insert JavaScript code to the parameter for Reflected Cross-site scripting attacks.
